metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0404 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In uvc_scan_chain_forward of uvc_driver.c, there is a possible linked list corruption due to an unusual root cause. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-111893654References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-96-generic - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-4.15.0-96-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-4.15.0-96-lowlatency - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-96-generic - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-96-lowlatency - 4.15.0-96.97
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-96.97').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1065.69').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
